chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant's bond shall be applied towards the costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey P. Mertens

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of E.L.H., Jr.

Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into record.  Victim rights complied with.  Attorney Tlusty moves to amend count 1 to misdemeanor theft - 943.20.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to the amended charge.   Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.   Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Kirkpatrick.  Statement by Jeffrey Mertens.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; $335.00 towing of the vehicle by the the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Bond to be applied towards all costs in all of the cases.   Appeal rights given to defendant.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to withdraw as counsel.  Defendant indicated that he wants to keep Mr. Morgan as his attorney.  Mr. Morgan indicated that he talked to the defendant and will still be his attorney.  Attorney Morgan is requesting that defendant's bond be reduced to a signature bond.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty objecting to the signature bond.  Court denies request to modify bond to a signature bond.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with E.L.H.-dob: 5-5-77.

DAR started at 11:26:10.  Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in court, in custody.   Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 16CF16 and 16CF17. Court advised DE of charges and penalties; advised of right to attorney and notice given to DE.
